content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals cos theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. If all of the other necessary conditions are met, which of the following could be modeled by <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​​​A scenario where the period is <math alttext="fraction numerator 1 over denominator 2 pi end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and the initial value for <math alttext="theta equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="0"><semantics><mn>0</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​A scenario where the frequency is <math alttext="fraction numerator 1 over denominator 2 pi end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and the initial value for <math alttext="theta equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="0"><semantics><mn>0</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​A scenario where the period is <math alttext="fraction numerator 1 over denominator 2 pi end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and the initial value for <math alttext="theta equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​A scenario where the frequency is <math alttext="fraction numerator 1 over denominator 2 pi end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and the initial value for <math alttext="theta equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​A scenario where the frequency is <math alttext="fraction numerator 1 over denominator 2 pi end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and the initial value for <math alttext="theta equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
